Erik Wilde (@dret): API Stories: Adding API Value to OpenAPI Descriptions

(2) Summary

The main business value of APIs is to allow teams to collaborate by publishing and consuming APIs. If APIs are designed and documented as products, then they allow teams to collaborate more effectively because no meetings and no specific coordination are required. In order for this to work, APIs must be treated as more than just technical interfaces. Their value has to be clearly described and documented, allowing producing teams to be clear about the value that they provide, and allowing consuming teams to understand the value that is made available to them. We have developed and implemented a small set of OpenAPI extensions that focus on describing the value of an API. By representing an API's value directly in OpenAPI, tooling can be built around these extensions, and API managers freely and openly exchange information about API value across different tools.

API Value Erik Wilde (@dret): API Stories: Adding API Value to OpenAPI Descriptions

(14) API Value = Potential ✖ Usage

  • Designed as building blocks focusing on value
  • Published easily contributing to the platform
  • Discovered in a catalog of all building blocks
  • Subscribed so that the building block can be used
  • Used to build new products
  • Improved to make the building block more valuable


API Value Erik Wilde (@dret): API Stories: Adding API Value to OpenAPI Descriptions

(15) Openness and Automation

  • Create an open API platform that itself is open as well
    • Open API platform means any API can be added to it
    • Open API platform means the platform is built openly
  • Communicating value through the platform needs open formats
  • API value needs to be communicated through the toolchain


API Value Erik Wilde (@dret): API Stories: Adding API Value to OpenAPI Descriptions

(16) API Value Chain



API Value Erik Wilde (@dret): API Stories: Adding API Value to OpenAPI Descriptions

(17) Out-of-line or Inline?

  • Out-of-line provides better decoupling from specific formats
  • Inline allows easier flow through toolchains and ecosystems
  • Combining both combines both advantages
    • Media types allow standalone representation and exchange
    • Extensions allow representation to be embedded into existing toolchains

API Stories Erik Wilde (@dret): API Stories: Adding API Value to OpenAPI Descriptions

(19) User Stories

  • User stories are a type of boundary object
  • They facilitate sensemaking and communication
  • They help teams document their understanding of a system and its context
As a <role> I can <capability>, so that <receive benefit>.


API Stories Erik Wilde (@dret): API Stories: Adding API Value to OpenAPI Descriptions

(20) API Story Example 

{ "value-prop": 
  { "stories": [
    { "story": {
        "href": "http://...",
        "title": "Customer engagement history",
        "as-a": "Marketing campaign manager",
        "i-can": "Access the history of our engagements with customers",
        "so-that": "I can better target and design our campaigns"
}}]}}
  • api-story.json

API Canvas Erik Wilde (@dret): API Stories: Adding API Value to OpenAPI Descriptions

(22) Value-Oriented Canvases

  • A canvas is a strategic management template
  • It facilitates structured thinking and communications
  • It helps documenting the main value propositions


API Canvas Erik Wilde (@dret): API Stories: Adding API Value to OpenAPI Descriptions

(23) Existing API Canvases

  • Microservice Design Canvas
    • Matt McLarty and Irakli Nadareishvili, "Streamlined Microservice Design in Practice", December 2017 [https://dzone.com/articles/streamlined-microservice-design-in-practice]
    • James Higginbotham's version [https://launchany.com/microservice-design-canvas/]
    • Chris Richardson's version [https://chrisrichardson.net/post/microservices/general/2019/02/27/microservice-canvas.html]
  • Value Proposition Interface (VPI) Canvas
    • Amancio Bouza, "How to Use the Value Proposition Interface Canvas", September 2019 [https://www.amanciobouza.com/post/how-to-use-the-value-proposition-interface-canvas]
  • APIOps API Canvases
    • API Value Proposition and API Business Model Canvases [https://www.apiopscycles.com/resources/api-canvas-instructions]


API Canvas Erik Wilde (@dret): API Stories: Adding API Value to OpenAPI Descriptions

(24) Example Canvas



API Canvas Erik Wilde (@dret): API Stories: Adding API Value to OpenAPI Descriptions

(25) Canvas Example 

{ "value-prop": 
  { "canvases": [
    { "canvas": {
        "href": "http://...",
        "type": "http://...",
        "name": "Issues Service",
        "description": "Manages the Issues...",
        "tasks": "- Create Issue ...",
        "dependencies": ""
}}]}}
  • canvas.json

Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): API Stories: Adding API Value to OpenAPI Descriptions

(27) End-to-End API Value

  • Communicating API value end-to-end in heterogeneous API landscapes
  • Enabling tools to represent and exchange value-related information
  • Creating community consensus around media types and OpenAPI extensions


Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): API Stories: Adding API Value to OpenAPI Descriptions
